definition: to act with confusion/to be in a flurry/to be flustered
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
busy/hurriedly/to hurry/to rush
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
variant of 角[jue2]/role
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: He scrambled widely to pick up the broken glasses before his guests could see them.
sentences.chinese: 他手忙腳亂地去揀摔壞了的眼鏡片，免得讓客人看見。

sentences.english: The vendor thanked him and peddled away.
sentences.chinese: 而那個小販謝謝他，手忙腳亂地走了。

sentences.english: Amid all this hand-wringing, Americans have kept piling on more and more debt.
sentences.chinese: 美國人對於接踵而至的債務清單手忙腳亂。

sentences.english: The celebrating a sister-in-law to fluster ground changes clothes for heart orchid.
sentences.chinese: 慶嫂手忙腳亂地給心蘭換着衣服。

sentences.english: She must be very nervous; she fusses about all the time.
sentences.chinese: 手忙腳亂地，一定是太緊張了。

definition: to strut/swaggering
to keep silent
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
to cry out in fear
stupefied/flabbergasted
to turn tears into laughter (idiom); to turn grief into happiness
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
brow beaded with sweat/perspiring freely
lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
to concentrate one's attention (idiom)
erhua variant of 一股腦|一股脑[yi1 gu3 nao3]
unwilling
to turn pale with fright (idiom)
sullen/to scowl miserably
head of a flight of stairs
